```{r libraries, warning=FALSE,message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggparliament)
library(tidyr)
```

```{r}
rm(list=ls())
#get the data for the last election
uk <- election_data %>%
  filter(country == "UK") %>%
  filter(year == 2017)

uk$seats[which(uk$party_short == "Con")] <- uk$seats[which(uk$party_short == "Con")] + 100
uk$seats[which(uk$party_short == "DUP")] <- uk$seats[which(uk$party_short == "DUP")] + 50

uk <- uk %>%
  #parl_data it out
  parliament_data(election_data = .,
                  party_seats = .$seats,
                  group = .$government,
                  parl_rows = 12,
                  type = "opposing_benches")

#plot it
plot <- ggplot(uk, aes(x, y, colour = party_short)) +
  geom_parliament_seats() +
  theme_ggparliament()

```
